intro: Hedyotis rajasekaranii, commonly known as the Rajasekaranii bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white or yellow flowers and opposite, ovate leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
